doc:section.doc:heading: Getting Started with RabbitMQ Broker
doc:section.p: Once you've installed the server and started it running, you'll want to perform a couple of basic administrative tasks.

doc:subsection.doc:heading: Change the admin password
doc:subsection.p: The default database contains a user named "guest" with a password of "guest". Use the password-changing tool from the command-line to set it to something private.

doc:subsection.doc:heading: Decide on strictness
doc:subsection.p: For interoperability reasons, the RabbitMQ broker defaults to a fairly loose interpretation of the AMQP standard in the area of access control. You may wish to tighten up the checking of AMQP tickets.
